page.title: 07St.Leonards Church.
page.content: The present church is almost 900 years old and was built on the site of a Saxon church. On the south wall is a scratch dial. When you put your finger on the centre of the dial the shadow points to what time it is. In the church are some very rare hand painted organ pipes. Roman bricks are inlaid in the unique stone altar screen. The font is cracked. This damage was done by Oliver Cromwell's soldiers. In the early 19 hundreds the roof collapsed during a service. There is now a new roof. The church is named after St. Leonard who is the patron saint of prisoners. Nowadays 50-60 people attend Sunday morning service. At the side of the church there is a children's altar and every Sunday about 20 children attend Sunday school. The church is now locked because of vandalism and pilfering.
